isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES - DT/DTI - 466 A AND B SERIES DIESEL ENGINES - SHUT-OFF CABLE DT/DTI-466 A and B Series (With UTDS Model 100 Fuel Injection Pump) - Installation

step1.para: Check control unit for proper alignment and freeness.
Make certain that control unit plate screw lock wire is positioned as shown in Figure 5.12.

figure.caption: Figure 5.12 Correct Lock Wiring Control Unit Plate Screws [Electric Shut-off Lock Wire Shown]

step2.para:
Install control unit cover (10, Figure 5.11)
with new gasket (11) to pump housing and secure with screws (7 and 8) and lock washers (9). Tighten screws to 28 lbf-in. (3 N.m).

Apply grease to both sides of gasket and thread solenoid assembly (1 thru 6, Figure 5.11)
to control unit cover. Tighten the solenoid assembly to a torque of 175 lbf-in.(20 N.m). Manually actuate solenoid plunger to insure that there is no binding or sticking in the assembly.

note.para: Pumps equipped with BOWDEN WIRE SHUT-OFF or SINGLE LEVER CONTROLS have a lock wire wound around both screw heads above the horizontal centerline. This lock wire arrangement used on pumps with electric shut-offs would inhibit solenoid plunger movement.

important.para: SOLENOID PLUNGER (4, FIGURE 5.11) MUST CONTACT CONTROL UNIT LEVER TANG AS ILLUSTRATED IN FIGURE 5.12. IF PLUNGER IS ALLOWED TO SLIP ABOVE OR BELOW CONTROL UNIT TANG, HAND TIGHTENING WILL BE INSUFFICIENT TO BOTTOM SOLENOID TO COVER. DO NOT USE A WRENCH, AS SERIOUS DAMAGE TO CONTROL UNIT AND SOLENOID WILL OCCUR.
